Category: 1. Retrieve Conflict Data (name, classification, overview, applicable IHL, parties) for Conflict(s) Involving an Individual Country/State Actor
Input: What conflicts is Palestine involved in as a state party to the conflict?
Generated Query: WITH "275" AS target_m49_code, "Palestine" AS target_actor_name OPTIONAL MATCH (sa:StateActor {UN_M49Code: target_m49_code}) OPTIONAL MATCH (c:Conflict)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(sa) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH COALESCE(sa.name, target_actor_name) AS country_name, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT c), []) AS conflicts, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT actor), []) AS all_actors, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT {conflict: c, type: ct.type}), []) AS conflict_types WITH country_name, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, COALESCE(SIZE(conflicts), 0) AS total_conflicts WITH country_name, total_conflicts, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "International Armed Conflict (IAC)"}) }]) AS total_IAC, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)"}) }]) AS total_NIAC, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Military Occupation"}) }]) AS total_Military_Occupation, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "International Armed Conflict (IAC)"}) } | conf.name] AS IAC_conflict_names, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)"}) } | conf.name] AS NIAC_conflict_names, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Military Occupation"}) } | conf.name] AS Military_Occupation_conflict_names WITH country_name, total_conflicts, total_IAC, total_NIAC, total_Military_Occupation, IAC_conflict_names, NIAC_conflict_names, Military_Occupation_conflict_names, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, [conf IN conflicts | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conf.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE([item IN conflict_types WHERE item.conflict = conf | item.type][0], "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END }] AS conflict_details WITH country_name, total_conflicts, total_IAC, total_NIAC, total_Military_Occupation, IAC_conflict_names, NIAC_conflict_names, Military_Occupation_conflict_names, conflict_details, CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded armed conflicts involving " + country_name + " as a state party." ELSE "According to RULAC, there are currently " + toString(total_conflicts) + " total distinct armed conflict(s) involving " + country_name + " as a party to conflict. " + CASE WHEN total_IAC > 0 THEN toString(total_IAC) + " International Armed Conflict(s) (IAC): " + apoc.text.join(IAC_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END + CASE WHEN total_NIAC > 0 THEN toString(total_NIAC) + " Non-International Armed Conflict(s) (NIAC): " + apoc.text.join(NIAC_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END + CASE WHEN total_Military_Occupation > 0 THEN toString(total_Military_Occupation) + " Military Occupation(s): " + apoc.text.join(Military_Occupation_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END END AS summary_text RETURN { summary: summary_text, conflict_details: CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN [] ELSE conflict_details END } AS RULAC_research
Output:
Based on the research data provided, Palestine is involved in the following conflict as a state party:

### Military Occupation of Palestine by Israel

This conflict is classified as a **Military Occupation**. Israel is recognized as the occupying power in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, and the Gaza Strip. The occupation has been ongoing since the end of the Six-Day War in 1967. Despite the Oslo Accords, which divided direct authority over the West Bank between Israel and the Palestinian Authority, Israel retains effective control over the entire territory. Additionally, Israel withdrew its ground forces from the Gaza Strip in 2005, but it continues to exercise significant control over the area, maintaining its status as the occupying power.

The applicable international humanitarian law includes the 1907 Hague Convention (IV), the 1949 Geneva Convention (IV), and customary international humanitarian law. Israel is a party to the Geneva Convention (IV) but has not ratified the 1977 Additional Protocol I. Palestine acceded to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions, the 1977 Additional Protocol I, and the 1907 Hague Regulations in 2014.

In addition to international humanitarian law, international human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict. Israel is a party to both the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and it remains bound by its international human rights law obligations in the territory it occupies.

Other state parties involved in this conflict include the Syrian Arab Republic, Israel, Lebanon, and the State of Palestine. Non-state parties involved include the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, Hezbollah, and Hamas.

Output:
Russia is currently participating in several conflicts as a state actor. Here are the details:

### International Armed Conflict
- **International Armed Conflict in Ukraine**: This conflict involves Russia and Ukraine, with parallel non-international armed conflicts (NIACs) between Ukraine and separatist groups in the east of the country. Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, starting a new phase of the conflict and exercising overall control over separatist groups, turning these NIACs into international armed conflicts.

### Non-International Armed Conflict
- **Non-International Armed Conflicts in Syria**: Multiple and overlapping NIACs are occurring in Syria. The Syrian Government and its allies, including Russia, are involved in NIACs against several rebel groups. There are also parallel NIACs between various armed groups operating in the territory, as well as NIACs between foreign state forces and armed groups on Syrian territory.

### Military Occupations
- **Military Occupation of Georgia by Russia**: Russia is the occupying power in areas of South Ossetia and Abkhazia, which are internationally recognized as part of Georgia. Russia maintains a military presence in these breakaway regions and exercises control over separatist armed groups.
- **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**: Since March 2014, Russia has occupied Crimea and, since February 2022, large territories in the south and east of Ukraine. The situation is classified as a military occupation despite alleged consent or referendums.
- **Military Occupation of Moldova by Russia**: Russia occupies part of Moldovan territory known as Transdniestria. The Operational Group of Russian Forces is stationed there without the consent of Moldova, and Russia exercises control over separatist armed groups in the region.

These conflicts highlight Russia's involvement in various types of armed conflicts, both international and non-international, as well as military occupations.

Category: 1b. Retrieve Conflict Data BY TYPE (name, classification, overview, applicable IHL, parties) for Conflict(s) Taking Place in a Specific Country or Region
Input: Is India involved in any military occupations?
Generated Query: WITH "356" AS target_m49_code, "India" AS target_actor_name, "Military Occupation" AS target_conflict_type OPTIONAL MATCH (sa:StateActor {UN_M49Code: target_m49_code}) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) WHERE ct.type = target_conflict_type OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(other_actor) WITH COALESCE(sa.name, target_actor_name) AS country_name, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) AS conflicts, COLLECT(DISTINCT other_actor) AS all_actors WITH country_name, conflicts, all_actors, COALESCE(SIZE(conflicts), 0) AS total_conflicts WITH country_name, total_conflicts, conflicts, all_actors, [c IN conflicts | c.name] AS conflict_name_list, [conflict IN conflicts | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conflict.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: "Military Occupation", conflict_overview: COALESCE(conflict.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conflict.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conflict.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) ]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([ p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) | p.name ], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) ]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([ p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) | p.name ], ", ") END } ] AS conflict_details WITH country_name, total_conflicts, conflict_name_list, conflict_details, CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded 'Military Occupation' conflicts involving " + country_name + " as a state party." ELSE "According to RULAC, there are currently " + toString(total_conflicts) + " Military Occupation conflict(s) involving " + country_name + " as a state party: " + apoc.text.join(conflict_name_list, ", ") + "." END AS summary_text RETURN { summary: summary_text, conflict_details: CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN [] ELSE conflict_details END } AS RULAC_research
Output: Based on the research data provided from RULAC, **India is not involved in any military occupations**. According to the information, there are currently no recorded "Military Occupation" conflicts involving India as a state party.

Output:
According to the research data provided, Ethiopia is involved in two non-international armed conflicts:

1. **Non-international armed conflict in Somalia**:
   - This conflict involves the internationally recognized federal government of Somalia fighting against Islamist insurgents, most prominently the armed group al-Shabaab, which has pledged allegiance to al-Qaeda.
   - The African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), previously known as the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM), is a peacekeeping operation supporting the Somali government. Its military component is a party to the armed conflict.
   - In addition to contributing troops to AMISOM, Kenyan and Ethiopian armed forces also operate independently in the country.
   - The United States conducts ground and air operations against al-Shabaab and provides material support to AMISOM and Somali security forces.
   - The non-international armed conflict involving al-Shabaab has spilled over into Kenya.

2. **Non-international armed conflicts in Ethiopia**:
   - The Ethiopian central government has been engaging in a non-international armed conflict against the Oromo Liberation Army (OLA).
   - Furthermore, Ethiopia was party to a non-international armed conflict against the Tigray People’s Liberation Front (TPLF).
   - It has been reported that Eritrean troops were also fighting against the non-state forces.

Both conflicts are classified as **Non-International Armed Conflicts (NIAC)**.

The Syrian Government and its allies are involved in NIACs against several rebel groups, including the Syrian National Army, Hay’at Tahrir al-Sham, the Islamic State group, the Syrian Democratic Forces, and other smaller armed groups. Additionally, there are parallel NIACs between these armed groups operating in the territory. Furthermore, multiple NIACs are taking place between foreign state forces and armed groups on Syrian territory:

- Two parallel NIACs between the US-led coalition and the Islamic State and Al-Qaeda.
- Two NIACs between Türkiye and the Islamic State and Kurdish militia.
- A NIAC between Israel and Hezbollah.

**Applicable International Humanitarian Law:**
All parties to the conflict are bound by Article 3 common to the 1949 Geneva Conventions, which provides for the minimum standard to be respected and requires humane treatment without adverse distinction of all persons not or no longer taking active parts in hostilities. It prohibits murder, mutilation, torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment, hostage taking, and unfair trials. All parties are bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to non-international armed conflict. In addition to international humanitarian law, international human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict. Under human rights law, the territorial state has an obligation to prevent and investigate alleged violations, including by non-state actors. Non-state armed groups are increasingly considered to be bound by international human rights law if they exercise de facto control over some areas.

**State Parties Involved:**
United States of America, Türkiye, Germany, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Syrian Arab Republic, France, Belgium, Russian Federation, Netherlands (Kingdom of the), United Arab Emirates, Australia

**Non-State Parties Involved:**
Islamic State group, Hezbollah, Syrian Democratic Forces (including YPG), Ahrar al-Sham, Hay'at Tahrir al-Sham, The Syrian National Army (SNA), former Free Syrian Army (FSA)

This conflict involves multiple parallel international armed conflicts against the so-called ‘Global Coalition’ (led by the United States), Türkiye, and Israel. Türkiye is occupying parts of northern Syria, while Israel has been occupying the Golan Heights since 1967. The US-led coalition, formed in September 2014, includes 83 members such as the US, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Jordan, Morocco, the Netherlands, Saudi Arabia, Türkiye, the UAE, and the UK. Türkiye started direct military operations against the Islamic State and the Kurds in Syria in 2016 without the consent of the Syrian Government and has occupied parts of northern Syria since August 2016. Israel has been targeting Iranian and Hezbollah objectives in Syria, as well as Syrian forces and military targets, with operations intensifying in 2021.

The applicable international humanitarian law includes the four 1949 Geneva Conventions, to which Syria, Türkiye, the United States, and other coalition members are parties. Additionally, several countries are parties to the 1977 Additional Protocol I, which is applicable to international armed conflicts. All parties are also bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to international armed conflicts. International human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict.

The state parties involved in this conflict include the Netherlands, Italy, Belgium, Germany, United Arab Emirates, Israel, Denmark, France, United Kingdom, Australia, Türkiye, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Syrian Arab Republic, and the United States. There are no non-state actors recorded for this specific international armed conflict.

- National Resistance Front (NRF)

### International Armed Conflict in Iraq

This conflict involves Iraq and Türkiye. The ongoing airstrikes by Türkiye targeting the Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) in northern Iraq, without the consent of the Iraqi government, have led to this classification. The Turkish airstrikes against the PKK are an extension of the ongoing non-international armed conflict in Türkiye between the Turkish armed and security forces and the PKK. Both Iraq and Türkiye are party to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions, and Iraq is also a party to the 1977 Additional Protocol I applicable to international armed conflicts. According to the data provided by RULAC, there are currently two distinct armed conflicts taking place in Ukraine:

1. **International Armed Conflict in Ukraine**:
   - **Overview**: Between February 2014 and February 2022, there was an international armed conflict (IAC) between Russia and Ukraine, along with parallel non-international armed conflicts (NIACs) between Ukraine and separatist groups in the east. In February 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine, starting a new phase of the conflict. The NIACs turned into IACs as Russia began exercising overall control over these groups. Currently, Russia is occupying several regions of Ukraine, including Crimea.
   - **Applicable Law**: Both Russia and Ukraine are parties to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. They are also bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to international armed conflicts. International human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Non-State Parties**: Russian-backed militias, Ukrainian separatist groups

2. **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**:
   - **Overview**: Since March 2014, Russia has been occupying Crimea. Additionally, Russia has been occupying large territories in the south and east of Ukraine since February 2022. The alleged consent for Russian intervention and the Crimean referendum do not alter the status of the situation as a military occupation.
   - **Applicable Law**: The law of military occupation applies to the occupied territory of Crimea, as set forth in Articles 42 to 56 of the 1907 Hague Regulations, the fourth 1949 Geneva Conventions, and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. Both Russia and Ukraine are parties to these agreements and are bound by customary international humanitarian law. International human rights law also applies.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Non-State Parties**: No non-state actors recorded

These conflicts are classified based on international humanitarian law criteria and are considered currently active.

Based on the research data provided, the classification of conflicts taking place in Yemen is as follows:

### Non-International Armed Conflicts in Yemen

The conflicts in Yemen are classified as non-international armed conflicts (NIAC). There are multiple parallel and overlapping non-international armed conflicts occurring in the country. The primary conflicts involve:

1. **The Government and the Houthis**: This longstanding conflict has seen the Houthis assume control over Yemen’s capital, Sana’a. An international coalition led by Saudi Arabia has been intervening since March 2015 with the consent of Yemen’s President Hadi.

2. **The Government and al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula**: The government is engaged in a conflict with al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula. The United States has been undertaking targeted operations against al-Qaeda with the apparent consent or cooperation of the Yemeni government.

3. **Armed Groups Fighting Each Other**: Various armed groups, including the Houthis and al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, are engaged in conflicts with each other.

4. **The Government and the Southern Transitional Council (STC)**: The establishment of the STC in 2017 led to historical fault lines surfacing, resulting in a non-international armed conflict between the government and the STC.

### Applicable International Humanitarian Law

Yemen is a party to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions, and all parties to the conflict are bound by Article 3 common to these conventions. This article provides for the minimum standard of humane treatment without adverse distinction for all persons not or no longer taking active parts in hostilities. It prohibits murder, mutilation, torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment, hostage taking, and unfair trials.

Yemen is also a party to the 1977 Additional Protocol II, which is applicable to non-international armed conflicts. The ability of the Houthis and al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula to exercise territorial control over large parts of Yemen suggests that they fulfill the required criteria for the applicability of Protocol II. However, Protocol II does not apply between armed groups. All parties are bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to non-international armed conflicts.

In addition to international humanitarian law, international human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict. Under human rights law, the territorial state has an obligation to prevent and investigate alleged violations, including by non-state actors. Non-state armed groups are increasingly considered to be bound by international human rights law if they exercise de facto control over some areas.

### State Parties Involved

The state parties involved in the conflicts in Yemen include:

- Saudi Arabia
- Kuwait
- Bahrain
- United Arab Emirates
- United States of America
- Egypt
- Sudan
- Yemen
- Jordan

### Non-State Parties Involved

The non-state parties involved in the conflicts include:

- Houthis
- Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
- Southern Transitional Council (STC)

This classification is based on the factual circumstances and relevant legal criteria, and it is an objective determination that does not depend on the subjective will of the parties to the conflict.

According to the data provided, there is currently one distinct armed conflict taking place in Nigeria. This conflict is classified as a **Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)**.

### Conflict Details:

**Non-International Armed Conflicts in Nigeria**

The Nigerian Government is involved in two parallel non-international armed conflicts against Boko Haram and the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP). Additionally, there is a non-international armed conflict between ISWAP and Boko Haram. Since January 2015, the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF), composed of units from Nigeria, Niger, Chad, Cameroon, and Benin, has been supporting the Nigerian Government in the fight against Boko Haram.

All parties to the conflict are bound by Article 3 common to the 1949 Geneva Conventions, which provides for the minimum standards to be respected and requires humane treatment without adverse distinction of all persons not or no longer taking active parts in hostilities. It prohibits murder, mutilation, torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment, hostage taking, and unfair trials. Nigeria is also a party to Additional Protocol II applicable to non-international armed conflicts. The ability of Boko Haram and ISWAP to exercise territorial control over parts of Nigeria suggests that they fulfill the required criterion for the applicability of Protocol II, namely the ability to carry out sustained and concerted military operations; impose discipline; and territorial control enabling them (if they were willing) to implement Protocol II. However, Protocol II does not apply between armed groups. All parties are also bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to non-international armed conflict. Customary international law consists of unwritten rules that come from a general practice accepted as law. In addition to international humanitarian law, international human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict. Under human rights law, the territorial state has an obligation to prevent and investigate alleged violations, including by non-state actors. Non-state armed groups are increasingly considered to be bound by international human rights law if they exercise de facto control over some areas.

The applicable international humanitarian law (IHL) for the conflicts in Syria varies depending on the type of conflict. Here is a breakdown:

### Non-International Armed Conflicts in Syria
All parties to the conflict are bound by:
- **Article 3 common to the 1949 Geneva Conventions**: This article provides for the minimum standard to be respected and requires humane treatment without adverse distinction of all persons not or no longer taking active parts in hostilities. It prohibits murder, mutilation, torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment, hostage taking, and unfair trials.
- **Customary international humanitarian law**: This applies to non-international armed conflicts.
- **International human rights law**: This continues to apply during times of armed conflict. Under human rights law, the territorial state has an obligation to prevent and investigate alleged violations, including by non-state actors. Non-state armed groups are increasingly considered to be bound by international human rights law if they exercise de facto control over some areas.

### International Armed Conflicts in Syria
The involved states, including Syria, Türkiye, the United States, and other members of the coalition, are party to:
- **The four 1949 Geneva Conventions**: These conventions provide rules for the protection of civilians and other persons who are hors de combat.
- **1977 Additional Protocol I**: This protocol is applicable to international armed conflicts and is ratified by several states involved in the conflict, including Australia, Belgium, France, Germany, Jordan, the Netherlands, Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, and the United Kingdom.
- **Customary international humanitarian law**: This applies to international armed conflicts.
- **International human rights law**: This continues to apply during times of armed conflict.

### Military Occupation of Syria by Israel
The law of military occupation is set out in:
- **The 1907 Hague Convention (IV) Respecting the Laws and Customs of War on Land and its Annex**: Regulations Concerning the Laws and Customs on Land.
- **The 1949 Geneva Convention (IV) Relative to the Protection of Civilian Persons in Time of War**.
- **The 1977 Additional Protocol I**: This is applicable to international armed conflicts. Israel and Syria are parties to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions, but only Syria is a party to the 1977 Additional Protocol I.
- **Customary international humanitarian law**: This also applies during occupation and complements the protection granted by treaties.
- **International human rights law**: This continues to apply during times of occupation. Israel and Syria are parties to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and the International Covenant on Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights. Israel remains bound by its international human rights law obligations in the territory it occupies.

### Military Occupation of Syria by Türkiye
The law of military occupation is set forth in:
- **The 1907 Hague Convention (IV) Respecting the Laws and Customs of War on Land and its Annex**: Regulations Concerning the Laws and Customs on Land.
- **The 1949 Geneva Convention (IV) Relative to the Protection of Civilian Persons in Time of War**.
- **The 1977 Additional Protocol I**: This is applicable to international armed conflicts. Both Türkiye and Syria are parties to the 1949 Convention, but only Syria has ratified the 1977 Additional Protocol I.
- **Customary international humanitarian law**: This also applies.
- **International human rights law**: This continues to apply during times of armed conflict.

This summary provides an overview of the applicable IHL for the different types of conflicts in Syria.

### International Armed Conflicts

### International Armed Conflict

### Non-International Armed Conflicts
- **Non-International Armed Conflicts in Syria**: Russia is involved in multiple and overlapping non-international armed conflicts in Syria. - **Military Occupation of Moldova by Russia**: Russia occupies part of Moldovan territory known as Transdniestria. The Russian Operational Group of Russian Forces is stationed in this region without the consent of Moldova, and Russia exercises overall control over the separatist armed groups.

In summary, Russia is involved in one international armed conflict, one non-international armed conflict, and three military occupations.

Output:
Based on the research data provided, there are two distinct armed conflicts occurring in Ukraine:

1. **International Armed Conflict in Ukraine**
   - **Conflict Overview**: Between February 2014 and February 2022, there was an international armed conflict (IAC) between Russia and Ukraine, along with parallel non-international armed conflicts (NIACs) between Ukraine and separatist groups in the east of the country. In February 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine, marking a new phase of the conflict. The NIACs turned into IACs as Russia started exercising overall control over these groups. Currently, Russia is occupying several regions of Ukraine, including Crimea.
   - **Applicable International Humanitarian Law**: Both Russia and Ukraine are parties to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. They are also bound by customary international humanitarian law applicable to international armed conflicts. Additionally, international human rights law continues to apply during times of armed conflict.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Non-State Parties**: Russian-backed militias, Ukrainian separatist groups

2. **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**
   - **Conflict Overview**: Since March 2014, Russia has been occupying Crimea. Additionally, Russia has been occupying large territories in the south and the east of Ukraine since February 2022. The alleged consent for Russian intervention and the Crimean referendum do not alter the status of Crimea as a military occupation.
   - **Applicable International Humanitarian Law**: The law of military occupation applies to the occupied territory of Crimea, as set forth in Articles 42 to 56 of the 1907 Hague Regulations, the fourth 1949 Geneva Conventions, and the 1977 Additional Protocol I applicable to international armed conflicts. Both Russia and Ukraine are parties to the 1977 Additional Protocol I and are bound by customary international humanitarian law. International human rights law also applies, with the occupying power obliged to secure the European Convention on Human Rights.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Non-State Parties**: No non-state actors recorded

These conflicts highlight the complex and evolving nature of the situation in Ukraine, involving both international armed conflicts and military occupations.

Category: 4. Retrieve Conflict Data (name, classification, overview, applicable IHL, parties) for Comparing Two States' Conflicts

conflict_classification: COALESCE([pair IN conflict_type_pairs WHERE pair.conflict = conf | pair.type][0], "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END }] AS conflicts_per_state WITH COLLECT({ state_name: sa.name, state_UN_M49Code: sa.UN_M49Code, total_conflicts: total_conflicts, conflict_names: conflict_names, conflicts_per_state: conflicts_per_state }) AS state_conflict_summary WITH state_conflict_summary, apoc.coll.flatten([st IN state_conflict_summary | st.conflicts_per_state]) AS conflict_details, state_conflict_summary[0] AS state_1_data, state_conflict_summary[1] AS state_2_data RETURN { summary: CASE WHEN size(state_conflict_summary) < 2 THEN "Insufficient data to compare conflicts for the requested states." WHEN state_1_data.total_conflicts = 0 AND state_2_data.total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, neither " + state_1_data.state_name + " nor " + state_2_data.state_name + " are currently party to any conflicts." WHEN state_1_data.total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, " + state_1_data.state_name + " is not currently party to any conflicts. Meanwhile, " + state_2_data.state_name + " is a state party to " + toString(state_2_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_2_data.conflict_names, ", ") + "." WHEN state_2_data.total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, " + state_2_data.state_name + " is not currently party to any conflicts. Meanwhile, " + state_1_data.state_name + " is a state party to " + toString(state_1_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_1_data.conflict_names, ", ") + "." WHEN state_1_data.total_conflicts > state_2_data.total_conflicts THEN "According to RULAC, in a comparison between " + state_1_data.state_name + " and " + state_2_data.state_name + ", the state currently party to the most distinct armed conflicts is " + state_1_data.state_name + ", being a state party to " + toString(state_1_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_1_data.conflict_names, ", ") + ". Meanwhile, " + state_2_data.state_name + " is a state party to " + toString(state_2_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_2_data.conflict_names, ", ") + "." WHEN state_2_data.total_conflicts > state_1_data.total_conflicts THEN "According to RULAC, in a comparison between " + state_1_data.state_name + " and " + state_2_data.state_name + ", the state currently party to the most distinct armed conflicts is " + state_2_data.state_name + ", being a state party to " + toString(state_2_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_2_data.conflict_names, ", ") + ". Meanwhile, " + state_1_data.state_name + " is a state party to " + toString(state_1_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts: " + apoc.text.join(state_1_data.conflict_names, ", ") + "." ELSE "According to RULAC, in a comparison between " + state_1_data.state_name + " and " + state_2_data.state_name + ", both states are equally party to " + toString(state_1_data.total_conflicts) + " total conflicts. " + state_1_data.state_name + " is party to: " + apoc.text.join(state_1_data.conflict_names, ", ") + ". " + state_2_data.state_name + " is party to: " + apoc.text.join(state_2_data.conflict_names, ", ") + "." END, conflict_details: conflict_details } AS RULAC_research
Output:
Based on the research data provided, India is involved in more conflicts as a state actor compared to China.

### Conflicts Involving India

1. **International Armed Conflict between India and China**
   - **Conflict Overview**: India and China are involved in an international armed conflict over the control of two main regions, namely Aksai Chin and Arunachal Pradesh, and a number of smaller regions along the Sino-Indian border.
   - **Applicable IHL Law**: India and China are party to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and are bound by customary international humanitarian law.
   - **State Parties**: China, India
   - **Conflict Classification**: International Armed Conflict (IAC)

2. **International Armed Conflict between India and Pakistan**
   - **Conflict Overview**: India and Pakistan are involved in an international armed conflict over the status of Kashmir. The disputed status of Kashmir has been a source of conflict between India and Pakistan since the first Indo-Pakistan war in 1947.
   - **Applicable IHL Law**: India and Pakistan are party to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and are bound by customary international humanitarian law.
   - **State Parties**: India, Pakistan
   - **Conflict Classification**: International Armed Conflict (IAC)

3. **Non-International Armed Conflict in India**
   - **Conflict Overview**: The Government of India is involved in a non-international armed conflict with the Communist Party of India-Maoist, a non-state armed group. There is also a non-international armed conflict between India and separatist groups in Indian-administered Jammu and Kashmir (J&K).
   - **Applicable IHL Law**: All parties to the conflict are bound by Article 3 common to the 1949 Geneva Conventions and customary international humanitarian law applicable to non-international armed conflicts.
   - **State Parties**: India
   - **Conflict Classification**: Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)

### Conflicts Involving China

1. **International Armed Conflict between India and China**
   - **Conflict Overview**: India and China are involved in an international armed conflict over the control of two main regions, namely Aksai Chin and Arunachal Pradesh, and a number of smaller regions along the Sino-Indian border.
   - **Applicable IHL Law**: India and China are party to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and are bound by customary international humanitarian law.
   - **State Parties**: China, India
   - **Conflict Classification**: International Armed Conflict (IAC)

### Summary

- **India**: 3 conflicts (2 International Armed Conflicts, 1 Non-International Armed Conflict)
- **China**: 1 conflict (1 International Armed Conflict)

Therefore, India is involved in more conflicts as a state actor compared to China.

   - **Applicable Law:** 1907 Hague Convention (IV), 1949 Geneva Conventions (IV), and customary international humanitarian law.

   - **Conflict Type:** International Armed Conflict (IAC)
   - **Overview:** Syria is involved in multiple international armed conflicts against the US-led coalition, Türkiye, and Israel.
   - **Applicable Law:** 1949 Geneva Conventions, 1977 Additional Protocol I (for some parties), and customary international humanitarian law.

3. **Military Occupation of Palestine by Israel**
   - **Conflict Type:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Israel occupies the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, and the Gaza Strip.
   - **Applicable Law:** 1907 Hague Convention (IV), 1949 Geneva Conventions (IV), and customary international humanitarian law.

4. **Military Occupation of Lebanon by Israel**
   - **Conflict Type:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Israel has occupied the Shebaa Farms since 1967.
   - **Applicable Law:** 1907 Hague Convention (IV), 1949 Geneva Conventions (IV), and customary international humanitarian law.

### Conflicts Involving the State of Palestine

1. **Military Occupation of Palestine by Israel**
   - **Conflict Type:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Israel occupies the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, and the Gaza Strip.
   - **Applicable Law:** 1907 Hague Convention (IV), 1949 Geneva Conventions (IV), and customary international humanitarian law.

  1. Military Occupation of Syria by Israel
  2. International Armed Conflicts in Syria
  3. Military Occupation of Palestine by Israel
  4. Military Occupation of Lebanon by Israel

- **State of Palestine** is involved in **1 conflict**:
  1. Military Occupation of Palestine by Israel

Thus, Israel is a party to more conflicts than the State of Palestine.

(sa)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH gr.name AS region_name, gr.UN_M49Code AS geo_region_UN_M49Code, sa.name AS state_actor_name, COLLECT(DISTINCT actor) AS all_actors, c, ct WITH region_name, geo_region_UN_M49Code, state_actor_name, COUNT(DISTINCT c) AS total_conflicts_per_state_actor, CASE WHEN COUNT(DISTINCT c) = 0 THEN [] ELSE COLLECT(DISTINCT { conflict_name: COALESCE(c.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE(ct.type, "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(c.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(c.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(c.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN all_actors IS NULL OR size([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN all_actors IS NULL OR size([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) | p.name], ", ") END }) END AS conflict_details WITH region_name, geo_region_UN_M49Code, state_actor_name, total_conflicts_per_state_actor, conflict_details, CASE WHEN total_conflicts_per_state_actor = 0 THEN "" ELSE apoc.text.join([conflict IN conflict_details | conflict.conflict_name], ", ") END AS conflict_names_per_state_actor WITH region_name, geo_region_UN_M49Code, COLLECT(CASE WHEN total_conflicts_per_state_actor = 0 THEN NULL ELSE toString(total_conflicts_per_state_actor) + " conflict(s) involving " + state_actor_name + ": " + conflict_names_per_state_actor END) AS total_conflicts_by_state_actor, COLLECT(conflict_details) AS all_conflicts_per_state_actor WITH region_name, geo_region_UN_M49Code, [line IN total_conflicts_by_state_actor WHERE line IS NOT NULL] AS filtered_conflicts_by_state_actor, apoc.coll.flatten(all_conflicts_per_state_actor) AS conflict_details WITH region_name, geo_region_UN_M49Code, filtered_conflicts_by_state_actor, conflict_details, CASE WHEN conflict_details = [] THEN 0 ELSE size(apoc.coll.toSet([d IN conflict_details | d.conflict_name])) END AS total_distinct_conflicts RETURN { summary: CASE WHEN total_distinct_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded armed conflicts involving any state actors from " + region_name + " (UN M49 code: " + geo_region_UN_M49Code + ")." ELSE "According to RULAC, there are currently " + toString(total_distinct_conflicts) + " distinct armed conflict(s) involving state actors from " + region_name + " (UN M49 code: " + geo_region_UN_M49Code + "). Breakdown by state actor: " + apoc.text.join(filtered_conflicts_by_state_actor, "; ") END, conflict_details: conflict_details } AS RULAC_research

### Nigeria

Based on the research data provided, there are currently five distinct armed conflicts involving state actors from Eastern Europe. Here are the details:

### Conflicts Involving State Actors from Eastern Europe

1. **Military Occupation of Moldova by Russia**
   - **State Parties:** Republic of Moldova, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Russia occupies part of Moldovan territory, specifically the region known as Transdniestria. The Russian forces, numbering between 1,500 and 2,000 soldiers, are stationed there without the consent of the Republic of Moldova. Russia also exercises control over separatist armed groups in the region.

2. **Military Occupation of Georgia by Russia**
   - **State Parties:** Russian Federation, Georgia
   - **Conflict Classification:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Russia is the occupying power in areas of South Ossetia and Abkhazia, which are internationally recognized as part of Georgia. Russia maintains a military presence in these regions and exercises control over separatist armed groups.

3. **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**
   - **State Parties:** Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification:** Military Occupation
   - **Overview:** Since March 2014, Russia has occupied Crimea and, since February 2022, large territories in the south and east of Ukraine. The situation is classified as a military occupation despite alleged consent from local authorities.

4. **International Armed Conflict in Ukraine**
   - **State Parties:** Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification:** International Armed Conflict (IAC)
   - **Overview:** Between February 2014 and February 2022, there were parallel non-international armed conflicts (NIACs) and an international armed conflict (IAC) between Russia and Ukraine. In February 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine, starting a new phase of the conflict. Russia is currently occupying several regions of Ukraine, including Crimea.

5. **Non-International Armed Conflicts in Syria**
   - **State Parties:** Russian Federation (among others)
   - **Conflict Classification:** Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)
   - **Overview:** Multiple and overlapping non-international armed conflicts are occurring in Syria. The Syrian Government and its allies, including Russia, are involved in conflicts against various rebel groups. There are also parallel NIACs between different armed groups and foreign state forces, including Russia.

These conflicts highlight the complex and multifaceted nature of armed conflicts in the region, involving both international and non-international dimensions.

Based on the data provided by RULAC, there are currently four distinct armed conflicts taking place in Eastern Europe. Here is a breakdown by country:

### Ukraine
1. **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**
   - **Overview**: Since March 2014, Russia has occupied Crimea and large territories in the south and east of Ukraine. The occupation is considered a military occupation despite alleged consent from ousted President Yanukovych and a referendum in Crimea.
   - **Applicable Law**: The law of military occupation, including the 1907 Hague Regulations, the 1949 Geneva Conventions, and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. Both Russia and Ukraine are bound by customary international humanitarian law and international human rights law.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification**: Military Occupation

2. **International Armed Conflict in Ukraine**
   - **Overview**: Between February 2014 and February 2022, there were parallel international and non-international armed conflicts. In February 2022, Russia invaded Ukraine, turning non-international conflicts into international ones as Russia exercised overall control over separatist groups.
   - **Applicable Law**: Both Russia and Ukraine are parties to the four 1949 Geneva Conventions and the 1977 Additional Protocol I, as well as customary international humanitarian law. International human rights law also applies.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Non-State Parties**: Russian-backed militias, Ukrainian separatist groups
   - **Conflict Classification**: International Armed Conflict (IAC)

### Russian Federation
1. **Military Occupation of Ukraine by Russia**
   - **Overview**: Same as described under Ukraine.
   - **Applicable Law**: Same as described under Ukraine.
   - **State Parties**: Ukraine, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification**: Military Occupation

2. **Military Occupation of Georgia by Russia**
   - **Overview**: Russia is the occupying power in South Ossetia and Abkhazia, which are internationally recognized as part of Georgia. Russia maintains military presence without the consent of Georgia and exercises control over separatist armed groups.
   - **Applicable Law**: The law of military occupation, including the 1907 Hague Convention, the 1949 Geneva Conventions, and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. Customary international humanitarian law and international human rights law also apply.
   - **State Parties**: Russian Federation, Georgia
   - **Conflict Classification**: Military Occupation

3. **Military Occupation of Moldova by Russia**
   - **Overview**: Russia occupies part of Moldovan territory known as Transdniestria. The Operational Group of Russian Forces is stationed there without Moldova's consent, and Russia exercises control over separatist armed groups.
   - **Applicable Law**: The law of military occupation, including the 1907 Hague Convention, the 1949 Geneva Conventions, and the 1977 Additional Protocol I. Customary international humanitarian law and international human rights law also apply.
   - **State Parties**: Republic of Moldova, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification**: Military Occupation

### Republic of Moldova
1. **Military Occupation of Moldova by Russia**
   - **Overview**: Same as described under Russian Federation.
   - **Applicable Law**: Same as described under Russian Federation.
   - **State Parties**: Republic of Moldova, Russian Federation
   - **Conflict Classification**: Military Occupation

These conflicts are considered currently active unless otherwise specified. RULAC only tracks ongoing conflicts, and any data provided is for the current status of the conflict.

Generated Query: WITH "European Union" AS target_group_name OPTIONAL MATCH (org:Organization {name: target_group_name}) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa:StateActor)-[:IS_MEMBER]->(org) WITH org, target_group_name, COLLECT(DISTINCT sa) AS members CALL { WITH members WITH CASE WHEN size(members)=0 THEN [null] ELSE members END AS safe_members UNWIND safe_members AS state OPTIONAL MATCH (state)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH state, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) IN conflict_list | conf.name] AS conflict_names, all_actors, conflict_type_pairs WITH state, conflict_list, total_conflicts, conflict_names, all_actors, conflict_type_pairs, [conf IN conflict_list | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conf.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE([pair IN conflict_type_pairs WHERE pair.conflict = conf | pair.type][0], "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END }] AS conflict_details RETURN { state_name: CASE WHEN state IS NULL THEN "NoMembersFound" ELSE COALESCE(state.name, "Unknown") END, state_UN_M49Code: CASE WHEN state IS NULL THEN "N/A" ELSE COALESCE(state.UN_M49Code, "N/A") END, total_conflicts: total_conflicts, conflict_names: conflict_names, conflict_details: conflict_details } AS single_state_data } WITH org, target_group_name, members, COLLECT(single_state_data) AS states_conflicts WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, apoc.coll.flatten([s IN states_conflicts | s.conflict_details]) AS conflict_details WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, conflict_details, apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_details | c.conflict_name]) AS distinct_conflict_names, apoc.coll.toSet([s IN states_conflicts | s.state_name]) AS distinct_state_names WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, conflict_details, distinct_conflict_names, distinct_state_names, SIZE(members) AS total_members, SIZE(distinct_conflict_names) AS total_distinct_conflicts WITH org, target_group_name, total_members, conflict_details, distinct_conflict_names, distinct_state_names, states_conflicts, total_distinct_conflicts, [sc IN states_conflicts WHERE sc.total_conflicts > 0 | toString(sc.total_conflicts) + " conflict(s) involving " + sc.state_name + ": " + apoc.text.join(sc.conflict_names, ", ASEAN, which includes Malaysia, Brunei Darussalam, Lao People's Democratic Republic, Viet Nam, Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Philippines, Myanmar, and Cambodia, has member states involved in the following conflicts:

### Non-International Armed Conflicts

1. **Non-international armed conflict in Thailand**
   - **State Party:** Thailand
   - **Non-State Parties:** Barisan Revolusi Nasional (BRN)
   - **Overview:** Since January 2004, Thailand's armed forces have been engaged in a conflict against the BRN and associated groups in Southern Thailand. The BRN aims to liberate the southern provinces from Thai rule and establish an independent Islamic state.

2. **Non-international armed conflicts in the Philippines**
   - **State Party:** Philippines
   - **Non-State Parties:** Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF), Abu Sayyaf Group, Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF), Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), New People’s Army (NPA), Maute Group
   - **Overview:** The Government of the Philippines is involved in multiple non-international armed conflicts in Mindanao against various groups, including the MILF, Abu Sayyaf Group, MNLF, BIFF, NPA, and Maute Group. Additionally, the Philippine Armed Forces are engaged in a conflict against the New People’s Army.

3. **Non-international armed conflicts in Myanmar**
   - **State Party:** Myanmar
   - **Non-State Parties:** Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army (ARSA), Arakan Army (AA), Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA), Ta’ang National Liberation Army (TNLA)
   - **Overview:** There are multiple non-international armed conflicts in Myanmar between the Myanmar Armed Forces (Tatmadaw) and several Ethnic Armed Organizations (EAOs), notably in Kachin, Shan, and Rakhine states.

These conflicts highlight the significant role that ASEAN countries play in various armed conflicts within their territories.

Generated Query: WITH "OECD" AS target_group_name OPTIONAL MATCH (org:Organization {name: target_group_name}) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa:StateActor)-[:IS_MEMBER]->(org) WITH org, target_group_name, COLLECT(DISTINCT sa) AS members CALL { WITH members WITH CASE WHEN size(members)=0 THEN [null] ELSE members END AS safe_members UNWIND safe_members AS state OPTIONAL MATCH (state)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH state, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) AS conflict_list, COLLECT(DISTINCT actor) AS all_actors, COLLECT(DISTINCT {conflict: c, type: ct.type}) AS conflict_type_pairs WITH state, conflict_list, SIZE(conflict_list) AS total_conflicts, [conf IN conflict_list | conf.name] AS conflict_names, all_actors, conflict_type_pairs WITH state, conflict_list, total_conflicts, conflict_names, all_actors, conflict_type_pairs, [conf IN conflict_list | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conf.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE([pair IN conflict_type_pairs WHERE pair.conflict = conf | pair.type][0], "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END }] AS conflict_details RETURN { state_name: CASE WHEN state IS NULL THEN "NoMembersFound" ELSE COALESCE(state.name, "Unknown") END, state_UN_M49Code: CASE WHEN state IS NULL THEN "N/A" ELSE COALESCE(state.UN_M49Code, "N/A") END, total_conflicts: total_conflicts, conflict_names: conflict_names, conflict_details: conflict_details } AS single_state_data } WITH org, target_group_name, members, COLLECT(single_state_data) AS states_conflicts WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, apoc.coll.flatten([s IN states_conflicts | s.conflict_details]) AS conflict_details WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, conflict_details, apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_details | c.conflict_name]) AS distinct_conflict_names, apoc.coll.toSet([s IN states_conflicts | s.state_name]) AS distinct_state_names WITH org, target_group_name, members, states_conflicts, conflict_details, distinct_conflict_names, distinct_state_names, SIZE(members) AS total_members, SIZE(distinct_conflict_names) AS total_distinct_conflicts WITH org, target_group_name, total_members, conflict_details, distinct_conflict_names, distinct_state_names, states_conflicts, total_distinct_conflicts, [sc IN states_conflicts WHERE sc.total_conflicts > 0 | toString(sc.total_conflicts) + " conflict(s) involving " + sc.state_name + ": " + apoc.text.join(sc.conflict_names, ", ")] AS breakdown_list RETURN { summary: CASE WHEN org IS NULL THEN "No organization named '" + target_group_name + "' was found in the database." WHEN total_members = 0 THEN "The organization '" + target_group_name + "' was found, but currently has no recorded StateActor members in the database." WHEN total_distinct_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded armed conflicts involving any of the " + toString(total_members) + " members of '" + target_group_name + "': " + apoc.text.join(distinct_state_names, ", ") + "." ELSE "According to RULAC, '" + target_group_name + "' (defined as " + toString(total_members) + " members total, including: " + apoc.text.join(distinct_state_names, ", ") + ") contains state actors who are currently party to a total of " + toString(total_distinct_conflicts) + " distinct armed conflict(s). " + "They include: " + apoc.text.join(distinct_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " + "Breakdown by member: " + apoc.text.join(breakdown_list, "; ") END, conflict_details: conflict_details } AS RULAC_research
Output: Based on the research data provided from RULAC, there is no organization named "OECD" found in the database. Therefore, there are no conflicts listed that involve members of the OECD according to the information available.

Category: 2. Retrieve Conflict Data (name, classification, overview, applicable IHL, parties) for Conflict(s) Taking Place in a Specific Country or Region AND BY TYPE
Input: What conflicts are currently happening in Afghanistan?
Generated Query: WITH "004" AS target_m49_code, "Afghanistan" AS target_country_name OPTIONAL MATCH (co:Country {UN_M49Code: target_m49_code}) OPTIONAL MATCH (c:Conflict)-[:IS_TAKING_PLACE_IN_COUNTRY]->(co) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH COALESCE(co.name, target_country_name) AS country_name, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT c), []) AS conflicts, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT actor), []) AS all_actors, COALESCE(COLLECT(DISTINCT {conflict: c, type: ct.type}), []) AS conflict_types WITH country_name, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, COALESCE(SIZE(conflicts), 0) AS total_conflicts WITH country_name, total_conflicts, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "International Armed Conflict (IAC)"}) }]) AS total_IAC, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)"}) }]) AS total_NIAC, SIZE([conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Military Occupation"}) }]) AS total_Military_Occupation, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "International Armed Conflict (IAC)"}) } | conf.name] AS IAC_conflict_names, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)"}) } | conf.name] AS NIAC_conflict_names, [conf IN conflicts WHERE EXISTS { MATCH (conf)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(:ConflictType {type: "Military Occupation"}) } | conf.name] AS Military_Occupation_conflict_names WITH country_name, total_conflicts, total_IAC, total_NIAC, total_Military_Occupation, IAC_conflict_names, NIAC_conflict_names, Military_Occupation_conflict_names, conflicts, all_actors, conflict_types, [conf IN conflicts | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conf.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE([item IN conflict_types WHERE item.conflict = conf | item.type][0], "Unclassified"), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf)]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | p.name], ", ") END }] AS conflict_details WITH country_name, total_conflicts, total_IAC, total_NIAC, total_Military_Occupation, IAC_conflict_names, NIAC_conflict_names, Military_Occupation_conflict_names, conflict_details, CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded armed conflicts taking place in " + country_name + "." ELSE "According to RULAC, there are currently " + toString(total_conflicts) + " total distinct armed conflict(s) taking place in " + country_name + ". " + CASE WHEN total_IAC > 0 THEN toString(total_IAC) + " International Armed Conflict(s) (IAC): " + apoc.text.join(IAC_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END + CASE WHEN total_NIAC > 0 THEN toString(total_NIAC) + " Non-International Armed Conflict(s) (NIAC): " + apoc.text.join(NIAC_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END + CASE WHEN total_Military_Occupation > 0 THEN toString(total_Military_Occupation) + " Military Occupation(s): " + apoc.text.join(Military_Occupation_conflict_names, ", ") + ". " ELSE "" END END AS summary_text RETURN { summary: summary_text, conflict_details: CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN [] ELSE conflict_details END } AS RULAC_research
Output:
### Conflicts Currently Happening in Afghanistan

According to the data provided by RULAC, there are currently two distinct armed conflicts taking place in Afghanistan:

1. **International Armed Conflict between Afghanistan and Pakistan**
   - **Overview**: Since October 2021, Pakistan and Afghanistan have engaged in border clashes.
   - **State Parties**: Afghanistan, Pakistan
   - **Conflict Classification**: International Armed Conflict (IAC)

2. **Non-International Armed Conflicts in Afghanistan**
   - **Overview**: Afghanistan has been affected by multiple and overlapping non-international armed conflicts. The Taliban, now the effective government, is engaging in two parallel conflicts: one against the National Resistance Front (loyal to the former government) and the other against the Islamic State-Khorasan province (IS-KP).
   - **State Parties**: Afghanistan
   - **Non-State Parties**: The Islamic State group’s Khorasan province branch (IS-KP), National Resistance Front (NRF)
   - **Conflict Classification**: Non-International Armed Conflict (NIAC)

These conflicts highlight the complex and evolving nature of armed violence in Afghanistan, involving both international and non-international dimensions.

Category: 2. Retrieve Conflict Data (name, classification, overview, applicable IHL, parties) for Conflict(s) Taking Place in a Specific Country or Region AND BY TYPE
Input: Are there ongoing military occupations in Palestine?
Generated Query: WITH "275" AS target_m49_code, "Palestine" AS target_actor_name, "Military Occupation" AS target_conflict_type OPTIONAL MATCH (sa:StateActor {UN_M49Code: target_m49_code}) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) WHERE ct.type = target_conflict_type OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(other_actor) WITH COALESCE(sa.name, target_actor_name) AS country_name, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) AS conflicts, COLLECT(DISTINCT other_actor) AS all_actors, target_conflict_type AS classification WITH country_name, conflicts, all_actors, classification, COALESCE(SIZE(conflicts), 0) AS total_conflicts, [conflict IN conflicts | conflict.name] AS conflict_name_list WITH country_name, total_conflicts, classification, conflict_name_list, conflicts, all_actors, [conflict IN conflicts | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conflict.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: classification, conflict_overview: COALESCE(conflict.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conflict.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conflict.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) ]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([ p IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) | p.name ], ", " ) END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) ]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join([ p IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(p) AND (p)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conflict) | p.name ], ", " ) END } ] AS conflict_details WITH country_name, total_conflicts, classification, conflict_name_list, conflict_details, CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN "According to RULAC, there are currently no recorded '" + classification + "' conflicts involving " + country_name + " as a state party." ELSE "According to RULAC, there are currently " + toString(total_conflicts) + " '" + classification + "' conflict(s) involving " + country_name + " as a state party: " + apoc.text.join(conflict_name_list, ", ") + "." END AS summary_text RETURN { summary: summary_text, conflict_details: CASE WHEN total_conflicts = 0 THEN [] ELSE conflict_details END } AS RULAC_research
Output:
Yes, there is an ongoing military occupation in Palestine. According to the data provided, Israel is currently occupying the territory of Palestine. This occupation includes the West Bank, East Jerusalem, and the Gaza Strip. Israel has been recognized as the occupying power in these areas since the end of the Six-Day War in 1967. The law of military occupation, as set forth in the 1907 Hague Convention (IV), the 1949 Geneva Convention (IV), and customary international humanitarian law, applies to this situation.

### Conflict Details:
- **Conflict Name:** Military occupation of Palestine by Israel
- **Conflict Type:** Military Occupation
- **State Parties Involved:** Israel, State of Palestine, Syrian Arab Republic, Lebanon
- **Non-State Parties Involved:** Palestinian Islamic Jihad, Hezbollah, Hamas

This conflict is classified as a military occupation, and it involves both state and non-state actors. The occupation is characterized by Israel's control over the territory, despite some administrative authority being held by the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank. In the Gaza Strip, Israel withdrew its ground forces in 2005 but continues to exercise significant control over the territory.

OPTIONAL MATCH (region)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(sa:StateActor) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH region_code, region, COLLECT(DISTINCT sa) AS region_states, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) AS conflict_list, COLLECT(DISTINCT actor) AS all_actors, COLLECT(DISTINCT {conflict: c, type: ct.type}) AS conflict_type_pairs CALL { WITH region_states UNWIND region_states AS single_state OPTIONAL MATCH (single_state)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(indiv_conf:Conflict) WITH single_state, COLLECT(DISTINCT indiv_conf) AS indiv_conf_list RETURN { actor_name: COALESCE(single_state.name, "UnknownActor"), total_conflicts: SIZE(indiv_conf_list), conflict_names: [ic IN indiv_conf_list | ic.name] } AS single_actor_data } WITH region, region_code, region_states, COLLECT(single_actor_data) AS actor_breakdown, conflict_list, conflict_type_pairs, all_actors, SIZE(apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_list | c.name])) AS total_distinct_conflicts, apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_list | c.name]) AS unique_conflict_names RETURN { region_name: COALESCE(region.name, "Region with UN M49 Code " + region_code + " not found"), geo_region_UN_M49Code: region_code, number_of_state_actors_involved: SIZE([ab IN actor_breakdown WHERE ab.total_conflicts > 0]), "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ x IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) ]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join( [ x IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | x.name ], ", " ) END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ x IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) ]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join( Generated Query: WITH ["011", "015"] AS target_region_codes CALL { WITH target_region_codes UNWIND target_region_codes AS region_code OPTIONAL MATCH (region:GeoRegion {UN_M49Code: region_code}) OPTIONAL MATCH (region)<-[:BELONGS_TO]-(sa:StateActor) OPTIONAL MATCH (sa)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(c:Conflict) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_CLASSIFIED_AS_CONFLICT_TYPE]->(ct:ConflictType) OPTIONAL MATCH (c)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]-(actor) WITH region_code, region, COLLECT(DISTINCT sa) AS region_states, COLLECT(DISTINCT c) AS conflict_list, COLLECT(DISTINCT actor) AS all_actors, COLLECT(DISTINCT {conflict: c, type: ct.type}) AS conflict_type_pairs CALL { WITH region_states UNWIND region_states AS single_state OPTIONAL MATCH (single_state)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(indiv_conf:Conflict) WITH single_state, COLLECT(DISTINCT indiv_conf) AS indiv_conf_list RETURN { actor_name: COALESCE(single_state.name, "UnknownActor"), total_conflicts: SIZE(indiv_conf_list), conflict_names: [ic IN indiv_conf_list | ic.name] } AS single_actor_data } WITH region, region_code, region_states, COLLECT(single_actor_data) AS actor_breakdown, conflict_list, conflict_type_pairs, all_actors, SIZE(apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_list | c.name])) AS total_distinct_conflicts, apoc.coll.toSet([c IN conflict_list | c.name]) AS unique_conflict_names RETURN { region_name: COALESCE(region.name, "Region with UN M49 Code " + region_code + " not found"), geo_region_UN_M49Code: region_code, number_of_state_actors_involved: SIZE([ab IN actor_breakdown WHERE ab.total_conflicts > 0]), total_distinct_conflicts: total_distinct_conflicts, conflicts_per_region: [conf IN conflict_list | { conflict_name: COALESCE(conf.name, "Unknown"), conflict_classification: COALESCE( [pair IN conflict_type_pairs WHERE pair.conflict = conf | pair.type][0], "Unclassified" ), conflict_overview: COALESCE(conf.overview, "No Overview Available"), applicable_ihl_law: COALESCE(conf.applicable_law, "Not Specified"), conflict_citation: COALESCE(conf.citation, "No Citation Available"), state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ x IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) ]) = 0 THEN "No state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join( [ x IN all_actors WHERE "StateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | x.name ], ", " ) END, non_state_parties: CASE WHEN SIZE([ x IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) ]) = 0 THEN "No non-state actors recorded" ELSE apoc.text.join( [ x IN all_actors WHERE "NonStateActor" IN labels(x) AND (x)-[:IS_PARTY_TO_CONFLICT]->(conf) | x.name ], ", " ) END }], total_region_states: SIZE(region_states), region_state_names: [s IN region_states | s.name], actor_breakdown: actor_breakdown } AS single_region_summary } WITH COLLECT(single_region_summary) AS region_summaries WITH region_summaries, CASE WHEN SIZE(region_summaries) > 0 AND NOT region_summaries[0].region_name STARTS WITH "Region with UN M49 Code" THEN region_summaries[0] ELSE NULL END AS regionA, CASE WHEN SIZE(region_summaries) > 1 AND NOT region_summaries[1].region_name STARTS WITH "Region with UN M49 Code" THEN region_summaries[1] ELSE NULL END AS regionB WITH regionA, regionB, region_summaries, apoc.coll.flatten([s IN region_summaries | s.conflicts_per_region]) AS all_conflict_details RETURN { summary: toString( CASE WHEN regionA IS NULL AND regionB IS NULL THEN "There are no matching GeoRegion nodes for the requested query." WHEN regionA IS NULL THEN "One region was not found. Only " + regionB.region_name + " matched. " + regionB.region_name + " contains " + toString(regionB.number_of_state_actors_involved) + " state actor(s) involved in " + toString(regionB.total_distinct_conflicts) + " total distinct conflict(s). " + "Breakdown by region: " + regionB.region_name + " is defined by UN M49 code " + regionB.geo_region_UN_M49Code + " and therefore currently includes " + toString(regionB.total_region_states) + " states total: " + apoc.text.join(regionB.region_state_names, ", ") + ". " + "Among these, " + toString(regionB.number_of_state_actors_involved) + " state actor(s) are currently involved as a state party to conflict(s): " + apoc.text.join([ab IN regionB.actor_breakdown WHERE ab.total_conflicts > 0 | ab.actor_name + " is state party to " + toString(ab.total_conflicts) + " conflict(s): " + apoc.text.join(ab.conflict_names, ", ")], " ") WHEN regionB IS NULL THEN "One region was not found. Only " + regionA.region_name + " matched. " + regionA.region_name + " contains " + toString(regionA.number_of_state_actors_involved) + " state actor(s) involved in " + toString(regionA.total_distinct_conflicts) + " total distinct conflict(s). " + "Breakdown by region: " + regionA.region_name + " is defined by UN M49 code " + regionA.geo_region_UN_M49Code + " and therefore currently includes " + toString(regionA.total_region_states) + " states total: " + apoc.text.join(regionA.region_state_names, ", ") + ". " + "Among these, " + toString(regionA.number_of_state_actors_involved) + " state actor(s) are currently involved as a state party to conflict(s): " + apoc.text.join([ab IN regionA.actor_breakdown WHERE ab.total_conflicts > 0 | ab.actor_name + " is state party to " + toString(ab.total_conflicts) + " conflict(s): " + apoc.text.join(ab.conflict_names, ", ")], " ") ELSE "According to RULAC, in a comparison between " + regionA.region_name + " and " + regionB.region_name + ", the region with state actor involvement in the most distinct conflicts is " + CASE WHEN regionA.total_distinct_conflicts >= regionB.total_distinct_conflicts THEN regionA.region_name ELSE regionB.region_name END + " (UN M49 code: " + CASE WHEN regionA.total_distinct_conflicts >= regionB.total_distinct_conflicts THEN regionA.geo_region_UN_M49Code ELSE regionB.geo_region_UN_M49Code END + "), " + "with " + toString(CASE WHEN regionA.total_distinct_conflicts >= regionB.total_distinct_conflicts THEN regionA.number_of_state_actors_involved ELSE regionB.number_of_state_actors_involved END) + " state actor(s) involved across " + toString(CASE WHEN regionA.total_distinct_conflicts >= regionB.total_distinct_conflicts THEN regionA.total_distinct_conflicts ELSE regionB.total_distinct_conflicts END) + " total distinct conflict(s).
